channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: California Illegal Aliens May Get to Push #1 for a Phone Subsidy

item.title: Biden touts economic gains, acknowledges a long way to go
item.description: Interest rate cut "is not a declaration of victory, it’s a declaration of progress."

item.title: Amazon Fell Behind in AI. An Alexa Creator Is Leading Its Push to Catch Up.
item.description: Rohit Prasad is tasked with making the company a stronger rival to the likes of OpenAI, Microsoft and Google.

item.title: Donald Trump’s imaginary and frightening world
item.description: His grotesque caricatures serve as a way to paint an alarming picture of America under the Biden-Harris administration.

item.title: Report Says Illegal Aliens Responsible for Up to 75% of Violent Crime Arrests in Midtown Manhattan

item.title: Fed moves to protect weakening job market with bold rate cut
item.description: The move signals that the central bank is growing nervous about the declining labor market.

item.title: Chip Giants TSMC and Samsung Discuss Building Middle Eastern Megafactories
item.description: Potential projects in the United Arab Emirates could be worth more than $100 billion, though major hurdles remain.

item.title: Joe Biden preps to sell the economy — to boost his legacy and help Harris
item.description: Biden is determined to convince a skeptical public that he strengthened the economy.

item.title: How Intel Fell From Global Chip Champion to Takeover Target
item.description: Strategic missteps and the artificial intelligence boom have combined to reshape the fortunes of the U.S.’s most storied semiconductor company.

item.description: A poll shows that Americans who rate the agency tasked with protecting presidential candidates and government officials as good or excellent tumbled 2...

item.title: Is Sweden Turning the Corner on Open Borders?
item.description: Sweden was once a poster child for open-borders advocates, and regularly made headlines for the social problems associated with those policies. Howeve...

item.title: Vance’s media strategy takes a turn
item.description: He was Trump’s policy whisperer to key voting blocs. Now, he’s fueling rumors that Haitian immigrants in Ohio are eating cats and dogs.

item.title: The 27-Year-Old Billionaire Whose Army Does AI's Dirty Work
item.description: Alexandr Wang’s Scale AI deploys gig workers around the globe to shape how the big AI models behave.

item.title: Harris shows gains in latest Post polling average; Trump resists another debate
item.description: Get the latest news from the 2024 campaign trail in the contest between Vice President Harris and former president Donald Trump.

item.title: Weed, wages and same-sex marriage: The most intriguing ballot measures that voters will decide in November
item.description: Across the U.S. in November, voters will weigh proposals on election policies, minimum wage increases and marijuana legalization.

item.title: KKR Secures About a Third of Fuji Soft, Dousing Hopes of Bidding War
